Description: Limestone lintel of Pepy II: at the top there is a representation of the winged sun-disk, and below, a shortened titulary of Pepy II inscribed twice, once to the left, and once to the right. The whole is poor, incised work. It is now in two pieces.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: B. Porter & R. Moss, 'Topographical Bibliography of Ancient Egyptian Hieroglyphic Texts, Reliefs and Paintings' V (Oxford: Clarendon Press), p. 41.
Bibliographic references: James 1961 / Hieroglyphic texts from Egyptian stelae, etc. Part 1 (pl.38)
Condition: Fair; it is now in two pieces.
